pros: Target practice daily and good pay
cons: Could die or receive a life sentence

job_title: Donor Services in New Orleans, LA
pros: Community outreach, friendly coworkers, helping others in need
cons: Can work at very odd times

job_title: Donor Technician in New Orleans, LA
cons: High turnover, low pay, intense work

job_title: Mobile Phlebotomist in New Orleans, LA
pros: Traveling to different places and meeting different people
cons: To much drama. Management has favorites

pros: Some peope are nice, general environment ok
cons:
Extremely high turnover, inexperienced new people, poor management, low pay, long hours, stressful job environment. 
Management do not follow their own guidelines for promotions and raises, being an over performer does not get you anywhere with this company.

pros: Plenty of opportunity for overtime if you want it! Fun coworkers.
cons: Working every Saturday and sometimes later than expected hours.

review_title: Coworkers good team players, management talks down to employees and gives unfair raises. Very political.
job_title: Registered Nurse-therapeutic Apheresis in New Orleans, LA
pros: Great benefit package, wonderful coworkers.  That's about it.
cons: Management will lie and tell you that 32 hours, which is what's guaranteed "hardly ever happens" and that it's usually well over that VERY UNTRUE. Apheresis team gets barely over part time on a regular basis, but they will tell you having another job is impossible to do.  Hours are never set and you may not know how long your day will be or if you're even working until the morning of. On call pay is a joke and they claim to have "competitive wages" ha. Funny.

review_title: my experience is fair you have good and bad days depending on supervisors and co workers
job_title: Donor Tech/Phlebotomist in New Orleans, LA
pros: you get to save a baby or any cancer patient even a burn patient life by collecting the donated blood
cons: you have to put your family and household to the back burner, the blood center don't consider that we all have a life besides work, i think the blood center should consider to stop dives at 12pm on sundays some people like to go to church

job_title: Donor Technician in New Orleans, LA
pros: Holiday pay and health benefits begin day of hire
cons: Management was unprofessional and unwilling to train their employee's properly. Mobiles were 14 hour days for multiple days before receiving a day off. Mobile supervisor's and staff talk down to new employees and nothing is done by management to help make a better working environment for their new hires. The whole time working there I dreaded going to work and desperately searched for a new job.

job_title: Supervisor of Apheresis in Hammond, LA
pros: The knowledge that you are playing your part in helping patients that are in critical need of blood and its components.
cons: Poor management and salary. There is no company organization and they state that they are non profit, when actually upper management is making large profits off of blood donations.

review_title: I have the opportunity to participate in the chance to save lives.
job_title: Donor Support Technician in New Orleans, LA
pros: The chance to travel to different places; I have some awesome co-workers; and I love what I do.
cons: No set hours; lack of concern from management about concerns on drives.

review_title: Very much a family environment... Many of the staff have been here since before Katrina
job_title: Anonymous Employee in New Orleans, LA
pros: The health benefits, the good you do for the community, the people, the work environment
cons: Some don't get the schedule which can change week to week so you need to be flexible... I love that aspect though.
Laziest coworkers EVER!!!  Worst customer service I have ever seen in my life...they work you like a dog and they could care less about their employees...I COULD GO ON AND ON!!!

review_title: I've always loved this company. I was a blood donor before I became employed. I even left for 8 years and returned.
pros: Community & Customer service oriented. Great Benefits. The health insurance is top notch.
cons: High turnover rate in the departments that hold it together, donor services and recruitment.

pros: Good health benefits and 203b employer contribution.
cons: Unprofessional staff from entry level to CEO. Start communicating with staff and express some appreciation. Faulty mobile equipment and transport vehicles.
